title: Defining neurosymbolic AI
summary:
Here is a 2-line summary of the abstract:

Neurosymbolic AI aims to combine learning and reasoning by integrating logical and neural representations, but lacks a formal definition. The authors introduce a new definition that defines neurosymbolic inference as the computation of an integral over a product of a logical and a belief function.

title: Reasoning in Neurosymbolic AI
summary:
Here is a 2-line summary of the abstract:

The chapter describes a simple energy-based neurosymbolic AI system that can represent and reason formally about any propositional logic formula, combining learning from data and knowledge with logical reasoning. The system addresses challenges of data efficiency, fairness, and safety of Large Language Models and promotes the principled integration of reasoning and learning in deep networks.

title: Neurosymbolic Reinforcement Learning and Planning: A Survey
summary:
Here is a 2-line summary of the abstract:

The field of Neurosymbolic Artificial Intelligence (Neurosymbolic AI) is rapidly developing, with Neurosymbolic Reinforcement Learning (Neurosymbolic RL) being a key component that integrates neural and symbolic approaches to achieve transparency and explainability. This paper conducts a literature survey of Neurosymbolic RL, categorizing works into three taxonomies and analyzing the RL components, identifying research opportunities and challenges in this emerging field.

title: Relational Neurosymbolic Markov Models
summary:
Here is a 2-line summary of the abstract:

The authors introduce relational neurosymbolic Markov models (NeSy-MMs), a new class of end-to-end differentiable sequential models that integrate and provably satisfy relational logical constraints. These models can solve problems beyond the current state-of-the-art in neurosymbolic AI, provide strong guarantees, and are more interpretable, with the ability to adapt constraints at test time to out-of-distribution scenarios.

title: A Complexity Map of Probabilistic Reasoning for Neurosymbolic Classification Techniques
summary:
Here is a 2-line summary of the abstract:

Neurosymbolic AI combines neural networks with symbolic systems to improve classification, but the scalability of these techniques depends on the complexity of probabilistic reasoning problems. This paper develops a unified formalism for probabilistic reasoning and compiles tractability results to create a complexity map, helping practitioners determine the scalability of neurosymbolic techniques.

title: Scallop: A Language for Neurosymbolic Programming
summary:
Here is a 2-line summary of the abstract:

Scallop is a language that combines deep learning and logical reasoning, enabling users to write and train neurosymbolic applications efficiently. It achieves this through a flexible symbolic representation, a declarative logic programming language, and a framework for automatic differentiable reasoning, outperforming state-of-the-art models in accuracy, runtime, and other aspects.

title: On the Promise for Assurance of Differentiable Neurosymbolic Reasoning Paradigms
summary:
Here is a 2-line summary of the abstract:

This study evaluates the assurance of end-to-end differentiable neurosymbolic systems, which combine neural networks and symbolic reasoning, across various tasks and domains. The results show that these systems offer unique opportunities for assurance, particularly in cases where arithmetic operations are defined and input spaces are high-dimensional, but also highlight potential trade-offs between interpretability and adversarial robustness.

title: A Path Less Traveled: Reimagining Software Engineering Automation via a Neurosymbolic Paradigm
summary:
Here is a 2-line summary of the abstract:

The emergence of Large Code Models has transformed software engineering automation, but comes with trade-offs such as high computational costs and reduced interpretability. Neurosymbolic Software Engineering, a new paradigm, combines neural learning with symbolic reasoning and controlled chaos to enhance efficiency, reliability, and transparency in AI-driven software engineering.

title: Model-Grounded Symbolic Artificial Intelligence Systems Learning and Reasoning with Model-Grounded Symbolic Artificial Intelligence Systems
summary:
Here is a 2-line summary of the abstract:

Neurosymbolic AI combines neural networks and symbolic AI to leverage the strengths of both, and this work proposes a new approach to integrate these components using large language models as model-grounded symbolic systems. The approach is evaluated through preliminary experiments on axiomatic deductive reasoning procedures, showing improvements in learning efficiency and reasoning reliability.

title: On the use of neurosymbolic AI for defending against cyber attacks
summary:
Here is a 2-line summary of the abstract:

The abstract discusses the need for detecting and responding to cyber attacks, and proposes combining connectionist and symbolic AI using neurosymbolic AI to achieve this. The authors identify challenges and propose use cases for neurosymbolic AI in cyber security, and demonstrate its feasibility through two proof-of-concept experiments.
